results.title: Max Ernst: journey into the subconscious
results.brief_description: The inner world of painter, Max Ernst, is the subject of this film. One of the principal founders of Surrealism, Max Ernst explores the nature of materials and the emotional significance of shapes to combine with his collages and nether-world canvasses.
results.description: The inner world of painter, Max Ernst, is the subject of this film. One of the principal founders of Surrealism, Max Ernst explores the nature of materials and the emotional significance of shapes to combine with his collages and nether-world canvasses.

results.title: Matter into energy (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Explains nuclear fission and fusion in terms of converting mass into energy according to Einstein’s E=MC squared formula. Employs both animation and live photography.

results.title: Matter and energy
results.brief_description: The film presents the concept that everything in the universe may be reduced to matter and energy. Matter in its different forms is presented, elements, compounds and mixtures are defined, and the laws of conservation of matter and energy are stated. The film ends with a brief discussion on atomic energy.

results.title: Materials control
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Industrial Management”.
The job of getting the right material in proper amounts to the right place at the right time is described under three materials-control functions of management: (1) Procurement; (2) inventory control; and (3) control of handling and transportation of materials in the production process.

results.title: Matchmaker at work
results.brief_description: Outlines recent developments in the CRA group, including: - establishment of Hamersley’s second mine complex at Paraburdoo; the Bougainville Copper operation; Comalco’s integrated aluminium group, and integration of lead zinc interests into Australian Mining and Smelting.

results.title: Matalau: a Tolai Village in New Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
The last film in the series looks at a highly developed indigenous community - Matalau. Considers the impact Europeans have had on the traditional Tolai culture. Looks at the economy which is based on cash croppage - copra, cocoa, fishing and wage earning; and discusses future development.

results.title: Great Barrier Reef: marvels in miniature
results.brief_description: Living organisms taken from the waters of the coral reefs are examined under high power microscopes revealing the perfection of design and tremendous energies of minute creatures invisible to the unaided eye.

results.title: The Marvellous march of Jean Francois
results.creator_credit: Witold Giersz, Israel M. Berman and Sterling International
results.brief_description: The wonderful adventures of Jean Francois, a small drummer boy in Napoleon’s Grande Armee. Ingenuity and steadfastness lead Jean Francois around the world and through the peril of war and the elements back to his homeland.

results.title: Marriage today
results.creator_credit: Alexander Hammid, Irving Jacoby and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mcgraw Hill”.
Analysis of the married relationship of tow couples who have made their partnership work through a clear analysis of their mutual aims and co-operation in striving to achieve these aims. Neither of these marriages is perfect, for there are bound to be conflicts where different personalities are involved. But these people have their ideals and goals in true perspective and they are willing to work together to reach them.

results.title: A Man's hands
results.brief_description: A witty and fast-cut montage dramatising the activities of the human hand: squeezing, poking, fixing, scratching, zipping, playing and touching. Alternatively funny and moving, entertaining and informative.
